intro: Carex nubigena subsp. nubigena, commonly known as the cloud-like sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Native to alpine and subalpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of high-altitude ecosystems.
